messages.title: Twickenham's fearless fighter
messages.content: Having worked as an NHS doctor and a refugee officer for the United Nations, my background is not a traditional one for a politician. But since being elected as your Member of Parliament in 2015, I have given my all for our constituency.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposed to a third runway, focus on noise and air pollution reduction.
Advocacy for improving local rail services with newer trains and more frequent services.
Support for local school improvements and funding.
Working on schemes to tackle congestion in Hampton area.
Implementing laws to reduce illegal mooring and protect local river banks.

issues.education: Stronger Schools: improving local schools with investment and better funding.
issues.environment: Progress on Heathrow: tackling noise and air pollution; Tackling Illegal Mooring: protecting local river banks.
issues.transport: Better Train Services: more frequent services and modernity; Reducing Traffic Congestion: tackling congestion in Hampton.

community.content: Supporting local pubs: preventing demolition or change without consultation.

leaflet.personalStatement: In just two years, I have replied to over 25,000 pieces of correspondence from thousands of local residents, I have held weekly surgeries and assisted over 1,000 individual cases, I have held street stalls around the constituency at weekends, meeting thousands of local people, and I have attended hundreds of events in every part of our community. But there’s so much more to do. Twickenham is my home and I am passionate about achieving the best for our local area. On June 8th, I’m asking for your support to continue the work I am doing for our community.

politicalExperience.achievements: Replied to over 25,000 pieces of correspondence, held weekly surgeries, assisted over 1,000 cases, attended hundreds of events.

endorsements.endorsement: For a strong local champion, and for a secure, stable government led by Theresa May.

images.caption: Discussing how Heathrow can be better for residents with The Secretary of State for Transport.

I was proud to be named a ‘Pub Hero’ for my votes and support for pubs in Parliament.
I have attended hundreds of events in every part of our community.
Having worked as an NHS doctor and a refugee officer for the United Nations, my background is not a traditional one for a politician.
But since being elected as your Member of Parliament in 2015, I have given my all for our constituency.
Twickenham is my home and I am passionate about achieving the best for our local area.
Our community is home to some excellent pubs.
